result.title: Report on the influence of the perceptions of corruption and governance on EU citizens' support for EU Cohesion Policy
result.description: Basing on the data collected in WP1, UGOT will undergo several multi-level comparative statistical analyses to investigate the extent to which citizen perceptions of corruption and governance can systematically explain their support for EU redistributive policies (Cohesion Policy), and to what extent such preferences are heterogeneous based on country or regional-level factors. This analysis will feed into recommendations for EU policy-makers on how to better frame argument for Cohesion Policy

project.title: Perception and Evaluation of Regional and Cohesion policies by Europeans and Identification with the Values of Europe

result.title: Beta version of optimized firmware for 3D data acquisition
result.description: The new features are developed strictly according to the concept (D2.3). The single functionalities will be handled in singular steps in order for appropriate testing. Software components will work offline and off-board. The Alpha version of optimized firmware for 3D data acquisition will be developed and checked at M27 and demonstrated to all work package participants for evaluation. This activity will be monitored through the Action Plan and the completion and tests of the Alpha version will be verified. The feedback from Alpha testers will significantly determine the final design of processing functions. The Beta version will comprise functional correction from Apha testers. Single processing steps will be logically gathered into automised features. Components will work online. Real-time functions will be active. The Beta version will be demonstrated to all work package participants for evaluation.

result.title: Beta version of user application for maintenance and asset management
result.description: This is a result of Task 6.1. Operational management and maintenance of cultural heritage buildings and sites are increasingly conducted under Asset Management contracts. This deliverable is a software tool that allows the stakeholders to monitor the operational management process efficiently with real-time possibility. The long-term maintenance plan is the tool to manage risks and costs of maintenance and to monitor levels of quality of the heritage buildings and sites. Inspection and surveys can be performed objectively using condition assessment norms. By sending digital data directly from the site without any paper work in-between, the inspection processes are streamlined. This method significantly saves effort and time as actions can be taken immediately by the person in charge without assistance. The software will also be made available in the AppStore for use on the iPad or iPhone. The Alpha versions of the software will be tested and validated at M30. After preliminary test and validation, the Beta version of the software tool will be implemented in combination with use cases, and demonstrated at real projects. Continuous improvements including bug-fixing will take place within the project duration.

result.title: Beta version of user application for on-site deployment
result.description: This is a result of Task 6.2. Starting from the 3D models stored in INCEPTION Platform, related to Demonstration Cases, a dedicated Augmented Reality application will be performed. This deliverable is a software tool aimed at the enrichment of the heritage data and information that it will be possible to explore on-site. The Alpha version of the software will be tested and validated at M30. After preliminary test and validation and through feedback by stakeholders, the Beta version of the software tool will be implemented in combination with use cases and demonstrated at real applications. Improvements or bug-fixing will take place within the project duration.

result.title: Beta version of user application for off-site deployment
result.description: This is a result of Task 6.3. An immersive Virtual Reality application will be developed. This deliverable is a software tool aimed particularly at optimizing the off-site exploring and visualisation interface. The application will be tailored to non-expert users in the field of 3D graphics (researchers and experts in other inter-disciplinary fields) and to education and museum purposes. The Alpha version of the software will be tested and validated at M30. After preliminary test and validation and through feedback by stakeholders, the Beta version of the software tool will be implemented. Improvements or bug-fixing will take place within the project duration.

result.description: A first version of the Data Management Plan will be delivered in order to outline how research data will be handled during the project development and after the project is completed, describing what data will be collected, processed and generated and the followed methodology and standards. It will be specified how these data will be shared and made open, and how they will be curated and preserved.

result.title: NL Demonstration case user-oriented applications and validation results
result.description: This deliverable is a result from Task 5.3 and is the presentation of the 3D models and documented data from Dutch demonstration case. Technologies used and validated and work methodologies will be presented to the Stakeholders together with the main user-oriented outcomes. Results will be presented to Stakeholders through workshops, seminars and public presentations.
